grammar.title: 动名词作主语（protecting the environment）
grammar.definition: 当一个动作/行为作句子主语时，常用动名词（V-ing）表示“这件事/这个行为”。
grammar.structure: V-ing (+ 宾语) + 谓语 + 其他
usage: Protecting the environment 作整体主语，表示“一件事”。
动名词短语作主语时，谓语通常用单数形式（因为当作“一件事”）。

mistakes.explanation: 这里主语是“保护环境这件事”，用动名词作主语更自然。

examples: Protecting the environment becomes more and more important.
Planting trees can help clean the air.

grammar.title: 主谓一致：动名词短语作主语 + 谓语用单数
grammar.definition: 当主语是动名词短语（表示一件事）时，谓语动词用第三人称单数。
grammar.structure: V-ing ... + becomes/is/helps ...
usage: 把整个动名词短语当作单数名词看待。
不要被后面的名词（如 environment）干扰，真正的主语是整个短语。

mistakes.wrong: Protecting the environment become more important.
mistakes.correct: Protecting the environment becomes more important.
mistakes.explanation: 主语是“一件事”，谓语用单三 becomes。

examples: Protecting the environment becomes important.
Saving energy helps a lot.

grammar.title: 比较级 vs “越来越”：more important 与 more and more important
grammar.definition: more important 表示“更重要”（与另一个对象对比）；more and more important 表示“越来越重要”（随时间/程度递增）。
grammar.structure: more + adj.（对比） / more and more + adj.（递增）
usage: 对比两者：A is more important than B.
描述变化趋势：It is becoming more and more important.

mistakes.wrong: It is more important day by day.
mistakes.correct: It is more and more important day by day.
mistakes.explanation: day by day 表趋势，搭配 more and more 更准确。

examples: It is more important than before.
Protecting the environment is becoming more and more important.

grammar.title: 时间状语从句：when 引导从句的动词形式（when we go out）
grammar.definition: when 引导时间状语从句时，必须有完整的主谓结构；一般不用“when + 主语 + doing”来表达“当……时”。
grammar.structure: when + 主语 + 谓语动词（常用一般现在时）
usage: 表达习惯/规则：when we leave home, ...
表达将来时间（从句一般现在时）：when we go out tomorrow, ...

mistakes.explanation: when 从句需要谓语动词；going 不是谓语（缺少助动词）。

examples: Turn off the light when we leave home.
We can walk when we go out.

grammar.title: 逗号拼接错误（comma splice）与连接词连接两句话
grammar.definition: 英语中两句完整句子不能只用逗号连接；需要连词（and/but/so/because 等）或用句号/分号等。
grammar.structure: 句子A + and/but/so + 句子B；或 句子A. 句子B.
usage: 两句并列：..., and ...
因果：..., so ... / ... because ...

mistakes.wrong: We should protect the environment, it can make our life better.
mistakes.correct: We should protect the environment, and it can make our life better.
mistakes.explanation: 两个完整句子需要连接词或改成两个句子。

mistakes.wrong: We should protect the environment, can make our life better.
mistakes.correct: We should protect the environment, and it can make our life better.
mistakes.explanation: 后半句缺主语；同时两句需要连词。

examples: We should protect the environment, and it can make our life better.
We should protect the environment. It can make our life better.

grammar.title: 代词指代与一致：it / them / this 的选择
grammar.definition: it 指代单数/不可数或“一件事”；them 指代复数名词；this 可指代“这件事/这种做法”。需要保证指代清晰、数一致。
grammar.structure: it（单数/一件事） / them（复数） / this（这件事）
usage: 指代前面的一整件事：It can make our life better.
指代多个建议/方法：If everyone can do them, ...
指代某种做法：If everyone can do this, ...

mistakes.wrong: First..., second..., if everyone can do it, ...
mistakes.correct: First..., second..., if everyone can do them, ...
mistakes.explanation: 前面是两点/多项内容，应用 them 或 this 来保证一致与清晰。

examples: If everyone can do them, the environment will be better.
If everyone can do this, the environment will be better.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：tell / talk / speak（课堂提到的固定搭配）
grammar.definition: tell 强调“告诉信息/命令”；talk 强调“交谈/讨论”；speak 常指“说（语言）/正式表达/讲话”。课堂重点在于搭配与宾语结构。
grammar.structure: tell sb sth / tell sb to do sth / tell sb (that) 从句；talk about sth / talk to sb / talk with sb；speak to sb / speak English
usage: tell：强调信息传递或让对方做事（常见 to do）。
talk about：讨论某事；talk to/with：与某人交谈。
speak：更正式；也常用于“说某种语言”（speak English）。

mistakes.explanation: 课堂强调：tell 后面通常接 to do，不接 doing。
talk 表“谈论某事”通常要加介词 about。

examples: He told me to turn off the light.
Let’s talk about ways of protecting the environment.
She can speak English well.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：say vs speak（内容 vs 方式/语言）
grammar.definition: say 强调“说的内容”；speak 更强调“说话的方式/能力”或“用某种语言说”。
grammar.structure: say + 内容/that从句；speak + 语言 / speak to sb / speak up
usage: 描述内容：He said that it would rain.
描述语言能力：She can speak English.
描述说话方式：Speak up!

mistakes.correct: He said it will rain. / He said that it would rain.
mistakes.explanation: 表达“说的内容”用 say（said），并用从句承载内容。

examples: He said that it would rain.
She speaks English and Chinese.
Please speak up.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：talk to / talk with / talk about（搭配与侧重点）
grammar.definition: talk about 强调“谈论话题”；talk to 强调“对某人说/交流”；talk with 强调“与某人交谈（双方互动）”。
grammar.structure: talk about + 话题；talk to/with + 人
usage: 谈论某事：talk about something
对某人说：talk to somebody
与某人交谈：talk with somebody

mistakes.explanation: talk 表“谈论”通常需要 about。

examples: Let's talk about the plan.
I want to talk to you.
She talked with her friend.

grammar.title: 不规则动词变化与听力易考点：tell/speak/say/do
grammar.definition: 部分常用动词过去式和过去分词不按 -ed 规则变化，需要记忆；听力可能直接考过去式读音。
grammar.structure: tell-told-told；speak-spoke-spoken；say-said-said；do-did-done
usage: 写作/语法填空需区分过去式与过去分词。
听力中常出现 said /sed/，要能听出并拼对。

mistakes.explanation: tell 为不规则动词。
现在完成时用过去分词 done。

examples: He told me the truth.
She has spoken to the teacher.
I have done my homework.

grammar.title: 过去式 vs 过去分词：用法区别
grammar.definition: 过去式主要用于一般过去时（表示过去发生的动作）；过去分词用于完成时、被动语态，以及作形容词。
grammar.structure: 一般过去时：V-ed/不规则过去式；现在完成：have/has + 过去分词；被动：be + 过去分词；形容词：过去分词 + 名词/作表语
usage: 一般过去时：I ate rice yesterday.（过去式）
现在完成时：I have eaten rice.（过去分词）
被动语态：The apple is eaten by me.（过去分词）
形容词用法：the eaten apple / The apple is eaten.（表示“被吃的”状态）

mistakes.explanation: have 后必须用过去分词。

examples: I did my homework yesterday.
I have already done my homework.
The house is controlled by a central system.

grammar.title: 被动语态：be + 过去分词（含 be 动词多种形态）
grammar.definition: 被动语态表示“主语是动作的承受者”，基本结构为 be + 过去分词；be 会随时态变化。
grammar.structure: am/is/are + p.p.；was/were + p.p.；will be + p.p.；have/has been + p.p.；is/are being + p.p.
usage: 现在被动：The house is controlled by a system.
过去被动：The house was controlled by a system.
完成被动：The house has been controlled by a system.
进行被动：The house is being controlled by a system.（课堂点名：is being）

mistakes.wrong: The house is controlling by a system.
mistakes.correct: The house is controlled by a system.
mistakes.explanation: 被动要用过去分词，不用现在分词。

examples: The house is controlled by a central system.
The apple was eaten by me.
The machine is being repaired.

grammar.title: 过去分词作形容词：the eaten apple
grammar.definition: 过去分词可作形容词，表示“被……的/处于……状态的”。
grammar.structure: the + 过去分词 + 名词；be + 过去分词（表状态）
usage: 前置定语：the eaten apple（被吃的苹果）
表语：The apple is eaten.（苹果处于“被吃了”的状态/结果）

mistakes.explanation: 表示“被吃的”要用过去分词 eaten。

examples: the broken window
the eaten apple
The door is closed.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：experiment vs experience（拼写相近但意义不同）
grammar.definition: experiment 指“实验”；experience 指“经历/经验”。课堂强调不要混淆。
grammar.structure: an experiment（一次实验）；have experience（有经验）
usage: 科学实验：a successful experiment
工作经验：teaching experience

mistakes.wrong: a successful experience (想表达“成功的实验”)
mistakes.explanation: “实验”用 experiment，不用 experience。

examples: Proper preparation is essential for a successful experiment.
She has rich experience in teaching.

grammar.title: 长句翻译技巧：找介词/连词，从后往前理结构
grammar.definition: 英语长句常因介词短语/从句变长；翻译时先找介词/连词，把“附加信息”拆出来，再回到主干（主谓宾）翻译。
grammar.structure: 主干（主谓宾） + 介词短语/从句（修饰成分）
usage: 先锁定主干：Proper preparation is essential.
再处理附加部分：in science class / for a successful experiment 等，通常放在后面或前置作状语。

mistakes.wrong: 合适的准备是重要的对于一个成功的实验在科学课上。
mistakes.correct: 在科学课上，对于一次成功的实验来说，恰当的准备非常重要。
mistakes.explanation: 先拆介词短语，再翻主干更通顺。

examples: Proper preparation is essential for a successful experiment.
In science class, proper preparation is essential for a successful experiment.

grammar.title: 介词后必须接名词：介词 + 名词/动名词
grammar.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形；要接名词、代词或动名词（V-ing 视作名词）。
grammar.structure: prep. + n./pron./V-ing
usage: without + V-ing：without saying...
into + n./V-ing：into management / into doing...
for + n./V-ing：for success / for learning...

mistakes.explanation: into 是介词，后面要名词；manage 应变名词 management。
without 后接动名词 saying。

examples: She wants to enter into management.
He left without saying goodbye.

grammar.title: to do 与 doing：两种“动词变名词”的方式
grammar.definition: 动词可通过动名词（doing）或不定式（to do）构成整体：都可作名词性成分，但使用场景不同；介词后通常只能用名词/doing，不用 to do。
grammar.structure: V-ing（单词形式）/ to + V（两词整体）
usage: 作主语：Doing exercise is good. / To exercise is good.
介词后：interested in doing / without doing（不用 in to do）。
表示目的：to do 常表目的（I came here to learn.）。

mistakes.explanation: 介词 without 后不能接 to do。

examples: To learn English takes time.
Learning English takes time.
He left without saying anything.

grammar.title: 词性变化：动词变名词的常见后缀 -ment / -er
grammar.definition: 英语常用后缀把动词变成名词：-ment 表“行为/结果/领域”；-er 表“做某事的人”。
grammar.structure: manage → management；manage → manager；foreign → foreigner
usage: management 表“管理/管理层”；manager 表“经理/管理者”。
foreigner 表“外国人”（可数）。

mistakes.explanation: 需要名词，不能用动词原形。

examples: Good management matters.
The manager made a decision.
A foreigner asked for help.

grammar.title: It is 强调句（强调结构）
grammar.definition: It is/was ... that/who ... 用于强调句子中的某一部分（主语/宾语/状语等）。
grammar.structure: It is/was + 被强调部分 + that/who + 句子其余部分
usage: 强调人可用 who：It was Tom who did it.
强调其他成分常用 that：It is in class that we learned it.

mistakes.wrong: It is surprised to such a little boy ...
mistakes.correct: It is surprising to see such a little boy speak a foreign language fluently.
mistakes.explanation: 形容“令人惊讶”用 surprising；结构上用 to see... 更自然。

examples: It was in science class that we did the experiment.
It is Tom who speaks English fluently.

grammar.title: 感受类用法：surprised vs surprising（人感受 vs 事物特征）
grammar.definition: surprised 描述人的感受；surprising 描述事物“令人惊讶”的特征。
grammar.structure: be surprised + to do/at sth；It is surprising + to do/that 从句
usage: 人：I was surprised to see him.
事：It is surprising to see a little boy speak so fluently.

mistakes.explanation: 人用 surprised，不用 surprising。

examples: I was surprised to hear the news.
It is surprising that he can speak so fluently.

grammar.title: 感官动词 + 宾语 + do/doing：see sb do vs see sb doing
grammar.definition: see sb do 强调看见动作从头到尾（全过程/结果）；see sb doing 强调看见动作正在发生（进行中）。
grammar.structure: see + sb + do sth / see + sb + doing sth
usage: 全过程：I saw him enter the room.
进行中：I saw him entering the room.

mistakes.correct: See somebody do something / See somebody doing something
mistakes.explanation: 感官动词后不用 to do（除少数特殊结构）。

examples: I saw her cross the street.
I saw her crossing the street.

grammar.title: 固定搭配：invite sb to do 与 ask sb to do（不接 doing）
grammar.definition: invite/ask 表“邀请/要求”时，常用不定式 to do 表将来/未发生的动作；不用 doing。
grammar.structure: invite/ask + sb + to do sth
usage: 邀请：They invited me to join.
要求：Miss Liu asked us to be quiet.

mistakes.explanation: 邀请是让对方去做，还没发生，用 to do。
ask 后接 to do，不接 to doing。

examples: They invited him to give a speech.
The teacher asked us to stop talking.

grammar.title: 称呼用法：Miss / Mrs. / Ms. / Mr.
grammar.definition: Miss 用于未婚女性或对女老师的称呼；Mrs. 用于已婚女性；Ms. 不强调婚姻状况；Mr. 用于男性。
grammar.structure: Miss/Mrs./Ms./Mr. + 姓氏
usage: 未婚或老师：Miss Liu
已婚：Mrs. Smith
不强调婚姻状况：Ms. Wang
男性：Mr. Brown

mistakes.explanation: Mr. 仅用于男性。

examples: Miss Liu asked us to be quiet.
Ms. Wang will meet the parents.

grammar.title: 介词后接名词或动名词：without + V-ing
grammar.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形；通常接名词、代词或动名词（V-ing 充当名词）。
grammar.structure: prep. + n./pron./V-ing
usage: without + V-ing：表示“没有做某事”。
这是常考点：看到介词就优先考虑名词或 V-ing。

mistakes.explanation: without 是介词，后面用动名词 saying。
介词后一般不用 to do。

examples: He left without saying goodbye.
She passed the exam without studying much.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句变法：be/have/情态动词提前；没有则用 do/does/did
grammar.definition: 把陈述句改一般疑问句：若句中有 be、have（完成时）、情态动词（can/will 等），直接提前；若是实义动词句且没有这些词，则借助 do/does/did。
structure: 情态动词 + 主语 + 动词原形 ... ?
do/does/did + 主语 + 动词原形 ... ?
usage: 判断要用 do/does/did：看原句谓语动词形态（原形→do/does；过去式→did）。
课堂强调：不能凭感觉乱用 does/did，必须看动词形态或主语三单。

mistakes.explanation: 主语是 you，用 do，不用 does。
主语 he 是第三人称单数，用 does。
原句动词是过去式 made，对应助动词 did，后面动词用原形 make。

examples: You like apples. → Do you like apples?
He likes apples. → Does he like apples?
They made a cake. → Did they make a cake?
He has finished. → Has he finished?

grammar.title: 否定句变法：实义动词用 do/does/did + not；have 表“拥有”用 do/does
grammar.definition: 把句子改否定：be 动词后直接加 not；实义动词句用 do/does/did + not + 原形；have 若表示“拥有”常用 do/does（doesn't have），不要混成 hasn't have。
structure: 主语 + doesn't have + 名词
usage: 课堂强调：doesn't have（拥有）常考；现在完成才用 hasn't/haven't + p.p.

mistakes.wrong: He hasn't a book. (想表达“他没有书”)
mistakes.explanation: have 表“拥有”时通常用 do/does 构成否定。
否定句中 some 常改为 any。

examples: He has a book. → He doesn't have a book.
She is ready. → She is not ready.

grammar.title: 对划线部分提问：Wh- 词 + 一般疑问句语序
grammar.definition: 对句中某部分提问：先确定划线内容的类别（人/物/时间/地点/原因等）选 Wh- 词；再把剩余部分改成一般疑问句语序（be/have/情态提前，否则用 do/does/did）。
grammar.structure: Wh- + (be/have/情态/do/does/did) + 主语 + 动词原形 ... ?
usage: 课堂步骤：①划线部分换成 Wh- 词；②未划线部分变一般疑问句。
若划线是名词性内容（宾语），常用 what/which 来问“什么”。

mistakes.correct: What does the oven tell us?
mistakes.explanation: 实义动词 tells 需用助动词 does，且动词回到原形 tell。

examples: The oven tells us the time. → What does the oven tell us?
She eats apples. → What does she eat?

grammar.title: 宾语从句：作宾语的“句子”
grammar.definition: 宾语从句是“做宾语的句子”，在句子中充当名词性成分（宾语）。课堂用“书柜=放书的柜子”类比帮助理解。
grammar.structure: 动词/介词 + (that/wh-等) + 从句
usage: 它本质上是名词性成分，所以常对应“问名词用 what/which”。
常见：tell/know/ask + what/when/where + 从句。

mistakes.wrong: I don't know he is who.
mistakes.correct: I don't know who he is.
mistakes.explanation: wh- 引导的宾语从句语序为陈述语序（who he is）。

examples: I know what he wants.
She asked where we were going.

grammar.title: 第三人称单数：does/动词加 -s 的判断
grammar.definition: “三单”指第三人称单数（he/she/it/单数名词），一般现在时实义动词要加 -s/-es；构成疑问/否定时用 does，动词还原为原形。
grammar.structure: he/she/it + V-s；Does + he/she/it + V 原形 ... ?
usage: The oven 是 it（第三人称单数）→ 用 does / 动词加 s。
I/you/we/they 不属于第三人称单数 → 用 do，动词不加 s。

mistakes.explanation: 一般现在时第三人称单数谓语动词加 -s。
有 does 后，动词用原形 tell。

examples: He likes apples.
Does he like apples?
The oven tells us the time.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句：看原句动词形态选择 do/does/did
grammar.definition: 当句子谓语是实义动词且没有 be/have/情态动词时，把陈述句变一般疑问句要借助 do/does/did；选择依据是原句动词的时态与主语三单。
grammar.structure: Do/Does/Did + 主语 + 动词原形 ... ?
usage: 原句动词原形（一般现在时，非三单）：用 do。
原句动词三单（一般现在时，三单）：用 does。
原句动词过去式（一般过去时）：用 did。

mistakes.explanation: 主语 they 非三单，用 do。
原句是过去式 grew，应使用 did，且动词还原 grow。

examples: They grow vegetables. → Do they grow vegetables?
He grows vegetables. → Does he grow vegetables?
They grew vegetables. → Did they grow vegetables?

grammar.title: 不规则动词：grow-grew-grown（过去式与过去分词）
grammar.definition: grow 是不规则动词：过去式 grew 用于一般过去时；过去分词 grown 用于完成时/被动等结构。
grammar.structure: grow — grew — grown
usage: 过去：The tree grew quickly.
完成：The tree has grown quickly.

mistakes.explanation: has/have 后用过去分词 grown，不用过去式 grew。

examples: The plants grew well last year.
The plants have grown a lot this year.

grammar.title: 名词加 e 变动词：bath/bathe 与 breath/breathe（拼写+读音变化）
grammar.definition: 有些词名词形式不带 e，动词形式在词尾加 e，且读音常发生变化（尤其元音与 th 清浊）。
grammar.structure: noun (no e) → verb (+ e)
usage: bath /bæθ/（名词）→ bathe /beɪð/（动词）
breath /breθ/（名词）→ breathe /briːð/（动词）

mistakes.explanation: take a breath 用名词 breath。
情态动词 can 后接动词原形 breathe。

examples: Take a deep breath.
It is hard to breathe here.
He bathed the baby.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：spend 的核心含义（花费）与语境翻译
grammar.definition: spend 的核心含义是“花费”；当宾语是时间并强调时间流逝，可译为“度过”。做阅读时要根据搭配选择更准确的翻译。
grammar.structure: spend + 时间/金钱 + (on sth / doing sth)
usage: 花费时间做某事：spend time doing sth
花费金钱在某物上：spend money on sth

mistakes.correct: They spend time doing homework. / They spend money on books.
mistakes.explanation: time 常搭 doing；money 常搭 on + 名词。

examples: They spend time helping others.
She spent money on a new computer.

grammar.title: 阅读定位技巧：题干关键词交叉定位
grammar.definition: 做阅读不一定通读全文：先读懂题干，抓稳定关键词（名词/专有名词/时间地点），用“两个信息交叉”的方式快速定位答案段落。
grammar.structure: 关键词1 + 关键词2 → 锁定段落/句子
usage: 如题干包含 USA + young people + volunteer：优先在文章中找 USA/young/volunteer 等名词。
再核对动词搭配与选项细节（如 spend time doing）。

mistakes.wrong: 只看选项不读题干关键词
mistakes.correct: 先读题干→抓名词关键词→回文定位→再比较选项
mistakes.explanation: 题干读不懂会导致定位错段、选项靠猜。

examples: Young people in the USA volunteer to help others.
In summer, Alice volunteers at a hospital.

grammar.title: 阅读定位：两个信息交叉定位（双条件定位）
grammar.definition: 题干往往含有两条信息（人名/时间/地点/事件等）。先找到信息A对应位置，再在其附近用信息B交叉确认，锁定答案句。
grammar.structure: 关键词A（人名/专有名词） + 关键词B（时间/地点/动作） → 答案位置
usage: 先找稳定不变的名词/专有名词（如 Alice/Bill/USA）。
再找第二条信息（如 in summer / spend the whole summer）。
两条信息交叉出现的位置，就是答案高概率区域。

mistakes.wrong: 只找到 Alice 就直接选答案
mistakes.correct: 找到 Alice 后，再找 summer 信息交叉确认
mistakes.explanation: 只用一个信息容易落入干扰项。

examples: 题干：Alice + in summer → 在 Alice 段落里再找 summer。
题干：Bill + spend the whole summer → 找到 Bill 后再核对 spend the whole summer。

grammar.title: 后置定语与定语从句：修饰名词的成分放在名词后面
grammar.definition: 后置定语是“放在名词后面的修饰成分”。后置定语可以是介词短语，也可以是从句；其中“名词 + that/who/which + 从句”叫定语从句。
structure: 名词 + 介词短语（后置定语）：the apple on the tree
名词 + 定语从句（后置定语）：families that are not rich
usage: 判断是不是定语从句：看被修饰的名词（先行词）+ 引导词（that/who/which）+ 后面是否是完整从句。
后置原因：修饰成分较长/较复杂时放后面更清楚。

mistakes.explanation: 介词短语作后置定语，放名词后更清晰。
定语从句修饰 families，应放在 families 后面。

examples: I like the book on the desk.
They help families that are not rich.

grammar.title: that 的两种常见身份：连词 vs 关系代词
grammar.definition: that 既可以作连词引导宾语从句（不充当成分），也可以作关系代词引导定语从句（在从句中充当成分，如宾语/主语）。
structure: 宾语从句：V + that + 从句（that≈连词）
定语从句：名词 + that + 从句（that≈关系代词）
usage: 看 that 前面：若是动词（know/think/say 等），多为宾语从句。
若 that 前面是名词（families/books/people 等），多为定语从句。

mistakes.wrong: 把所有 that 都当代词理解为“那个”
mistakes.correct: 根据 that 前面的词判断：动词前后→宾语从句；名词后面→定语从句
mistakes.explanation: 人名前一般不加“那个+名字”，因此常见 that 在句中多是连接成分。

examples: I know that Jason is 18. (宾语从句)
families that are not rich (定语从句)

grammar.title: 宾语从句：做宾语的“句子”
grammar.definition: 宾语从句是在句子中充当宾语的从句，整体相当于名词，用来回答“知道/认为/说/问什么”。
grammar.structure: 动词 + (that/wh-) + 从句（陈述语序）
usage: know/think/say/ask + that 从句：I know that ...
wh- 引导：I know what he wants / where he lives

mistakes.wrong: I know what does he want.
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句用陈述语序，不用疑问语序。

examples: We know from the passage that Jason is 18.
I don't know where he lives.

grammar.title: the + 形容词：表示“一类人”
grammar.definition: the + 形容词可表示某一类人（复数概念），常用于表达群体：the rich / the poor / the old / the young。
grammar.structure: the + adj. → 一类人（复数意义）
usage: the rich：富人
the old：老人
the young：年轻人

mistakes.explanation: the rich 本身已表示“富人”群体，不必重复 people。

examples: The rich should help the poor.
The young learn faster than the old.

grammar.title: 双宾语结构：teach + sb + sth（主谓双宾）
grammar.definition: 有些动词可以带两个宾语：间接宾语（人）+ 直接宾语（物/内容）。teach 属于常见双宾语动词。
grammar.structure: teach + 人 + 内容
usage: teach sb sth：She taught me English.
teach sb how to do sth：He taught people how to build houses.

mistakes.wrong: He taught to people how to build houses.
mistakes.correct: He taught people how to build houses.
mistakes.explanation: teach 后可直接接人作间接宾语，不必加 to。

examples: The teacher taught us math.
He teaches people how to build a low-cost house.

grammar.title: 翻译策略：何时“从后往前翻”
grammar.definition: 当句子因介词短语/连词/从句导致结构变长、信息被“切断”时，翻译可先处理后置部分（介词短语/从句），再回到主干；若句子短且主谓宾清晰，则按正常顺序翻译即可。
structure: 长句：先翻修饰成分（介词短语/从句）→再翻主干
usage: 看到介词/连词/that/wh- 等，通常意味着后面有修饰或从句，先拆出来。
先翻介词短语（如 in reading）→再加“的”→回到名词（children）。

mistakes.wrong: 把所有句子都机械从后往前翻
mistakes.correct: 看是否有介词/连词/从句导致结构复杂，再决定是否从后往前
mistakes.explanation: 无介词连词时直接顺翻更自然。

examples: children with trouble in reading → 在阅读中有困难的孩子
He teaches children. → 他教孩子（顺翻）

grammar.title: 后置定语：修饰成分通常修饰“最近的名词”
grammar.definition: 后置定语（介词短语/从句）一般修饰它前面最近的名词（先行词）。因此一个修饰成分通常只对应一个名词，避免“同时修饰两个”造成歧义。
structure: 名词 + 介词短语：children with trouble in reading
名词 + 定语从句：children that have trouble in reading
usage: 判断修饰谁：先找修饰成分前面最近的名词。
阅读中后置定语多，会让句子变长、难懂，是阅读理解的常见难点。

mistakes.wrong: 把后置定语理解为同时修饰两个成分
mistakes.correct: 默认修饰最近的名词（先行词）
mistakes.explanation: 英语表达追求明确，修饰范围通常就近原则。

examples: the apple on the tree（on the tree 修饰 apple）
families that are not rich（that 从句修饰 families）

grammar.title: 动名词短语作主语：Reading books ...
grammar.definition: 动词加 -ing 可作为名词使用；动名词短语作主语时，整体视为“一件事”，谓语动词用第三人称单数形式（一般现在时常加 -s）。
grammar.structure: V-ing (+ 宾语) + 谓语（单数）
usage: Reading books is helpful.
Reading books makes people better.
关键：主语不是 books，而是 Reading books 这“一件事”。

mistakes.explanation: 动名词短语作主语视为单数，谓语用 makes。
作主语需名词化：用 Reading books（动名词短语）。

examples: Reading books makes me better every day.
Reading books helps us improve.

grammar.title: 主谓一致：看主语而不是看最近的名词复数
grammar.definition: 谓语动词是否加 -s 取决于主语的人称和单复数。即使主语短语里出现复数名词（books），也要以整个主语短语的核心（Reading books 这件事）为准。
grammar.structure: 主语（单数/复数） → 谓语动词形式
usage: Reading books（单数概念）→ makes
Books（复数）→ make

mistakes.wrong: 看到 books 就用 make
mistakes.correct: 判断主语是 Books 还是 Reading books
mistakes.explanation: books 可能只是动名词短语的宾语，不一定是主语。

examples: Books make people better.
Reading books makes people better.
